title: Giovanni dei Tagliacozzi
text:
Giovanni dei Tagliacozzi (died 1540) was a Roman Catholic prelate who served as <a href="Bishop%20of%20Chioggia">Bishop of Chioggia</a> (1535–1540).
Biography.
On 20 October 1535, he was appointed during the papacy of <a href="Pope%20Paul%20III">Pope Paul III</a> as <a href="Bishop%20of%20Chioggia">Bishop of Chioggia</a>.
On 7 December 1535, he was <a href="consecrated">consecrated</a> bishop by <a href="Defendente%20Valvassori">Defendente Valvassori</a>, <a href="Bishop%20of%20Capodistria">Bishop of Capodistria</a>, with <a href="Giacomo%20de%20Cadapesario">Giacomo de Cadapesario</a>, <a href="Bishop%20of%20Paphos">Bishop of Paphos</a>, and <a href="Vincenzo%20Negusanti">Vincenzo Negusanti</a>, <a href="Bishop%20of%20Arbe">Bishop of Arbe</a>, serving as <a href="co-consecrators">co-consecrators</a>. 
He served as Bishop of Chioggia until his death on 5 October 1540.
